prompt: Can you suggest a free website or program that can translate my 20-minute video and add subtitles?

hidden_queries: free website or program that can translate video and add subtitles automatically
free tools to translate and subtitle a 20 minute video
metadata.generated_search_query: free website or program that can translate video and add subtitles automatically

citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are free (or with free tier) tools you can use to translate a ~20-minute video and add subtitles. Some have limits or trials but can handle your task without paid software: Online AI tools (no install) Veed.io – auto-transcribes and translates subtitles into 125+ languages, export embedded subtitles or SRT. VEED.IO
Kapwing – web auto-subtitle + translator; works in browser, edit and export subtitles. Kapwing
Canva Video Translator – generates captions then translates them to other languages. Canva
Typito Video Translator – auto translate and download translated subtitles (SRT). Typito
ezVideoTranslate – free upload/URL translation and subtitles in 20+ languages. ezVideoTranslate
WayinVideo – auto transcripts and translates into 100+ languages. WayinVideo
Clideo Video Translator – translate video subtitles or audio, edit style and download. Clideo

sources.title: Add Subtitles to Video Automatically with AI - Online & Free Trial
sources.snippet: Easily add subtitles to videos with AI. Generate accurate captions in 125+ languages and export in SRT, VTT, MP4, and other formats. Try now for free.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Free trial / partial free options Maestra.ai – generates subtitles + can translate; has a free trial with file size limits. Maestra AI
HappyScribe – transcribe and translate video (free tier available). HappyScribe

sources.title: Translate & Add Subtitles to Video with AI Caption Generator
sources.snippet: Use Flixier’s AI caption generator to automatically create and translate subtitles to your videos, TikToks & Reels - with over 130 languages! No downloads.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Flixier – auto subtitles and translates in-browser (free with limits). Flixier

sources.title: VLC player demos real-time AI subtitling for videos
sources.snippet: At CES 2025, the open-source VLC media player showcased a new AI-powered feature that enables real-time subtitling and translation of videos directly on users' devices. Presented by VideoLAN President Jean-Baptiste Kempf, the demo highlighted the use of open-source AI models to generate and translate subtitles into over 100 languages completely offline, ensuring privacy and eliminating the need for cloud services. This feature is built directly into the VLC app, distinguishing it from earlier plug-ins that relied on platforms like OpenAI's Whisper. While the full rollout date hasn't been disclosed, the advancement demonstrates a significant leap in local AI integration for media playback. Additionally, VideoLAN announced that VLC has surpassed 6 billion downloads and continues to grow in active users despite the rise of streaming services.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Workflow tip Upload video to one of these tools. Let it auto-transcribe the spoken audio. Use the translate subtitle feature to convert to your target language. Export either burned-in subtitles or an SRT file that you can embed. If you want fully offline Tools like VLC (upcoming AI subtitle/translation feature) are being demoed but not yet broadly released. theverge.com
